solution_line_template: If the bracelets he sold at ${price_per_bracelet} made ${revenue_from_5_dollar_bracelets}, he sold ${revenue_from_5_dollar_bracelets}/${price_per_bracelet} = <<{revenue_from_5_dollar_bracelets}/{price_per_bracelet}={num_bracelets_at_5_dollars}>>{num_bracelets_at_5_dollars} bracelets.

If the total number of $5 bracelets was {num_bracelets_at_5_dollars}, then the total number of bracelets he sold was {total_initial_bracelets}-{num_bracelets_at_5_dollars} ={num_bracelets_sold_in_pairs}
If he was selling a pair of bracelets at $8, he sold {num_bracelets_sold_in_pairs}/{bracelets_per_pair} = {num_pairs_sold} pairs.
The total amount of money he made from selling the {num_pairs_sold} pairs is ${price_per_pair} * {num_pairs_sold} = $<<{price_per_pair}*{num_pairs_sold}={revenue_from_pairs}>>{revenue_from_pairs}

His total earnings from selling all of his bracelets are ${revenue_from_pairs} + ${revenue_from_5_dollar_bracelets} = $<<{revenue_from_pairs}+{revenue_from_5_dollar_bracelets}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}
